etomica.space3d

Interface IOrientation3D

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IOrientation
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IOrientationFull3D
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Orientation3D, OrientationFull3D

    public interface IOrientation3D
extends IOrientation
    Interface for an orientation in 3D. The orientation is defined by a single vector, so the oriented object must have linear symmetry for this to make sense. IOrientationFull3D can be used for an oriented object without linear symmetry.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void rotateBy(double dt, IVector axis)
      Rotate the orientation by the amount dt (radians) about the given axis.

      • Methods inherited from interface etomica.space.IOrientation

        E, getDirection, randomRotation, setDirection

    • Method Detail

      • rotateBy

        void rotateBy(double dt,
              IVector axis)
        Rotate the orientation by the amount dt (radians) about the given axis. If the given axis is considered "up" (out of the plane and toward the viewer), then positive rotation is in the counter-clockwise direction.
